page.title: 11GODOLPHIN HOUSE
page.content: Cont'd. The Godolphin male line died out in the 18th century and the property passed via marriage to the Duke of Leeds. He never lived in Cornwall and took little interest in the estate. In 1805 a large part of the house was demolished leaving the remainder to serve as a farmhouse and fall into decay. In 1937 the house was bought by Mr. and Mrs. Schofield who have preserved and restored the property. The house boasts several ghost stories and is open to visitors at certain times of the year.
